Class Invoice

java.lang.Object
payroll_system.Invoice
All Implemented Interfaces:
Payable
public class Invoice extends Object implements Payable
Purpose: The Invoice class represents an invoice containing billing information for a single kind of part. It implements the Payable interface and calculates the payment amount based on quantity and price per item.
Since:
2024-11-11
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Invoice

      public Invoice(String partNumber, String partDescription, int quantity, double pricePerItem)
      Constructs an Invoice object with specified part number, part description, quantity, and price per item. This constructor also validates the quantity and price per item before assigning them.
      Parameters:
      partNumber - the part number of the invoice
      partDescription - the description of the part
      quantity - the quantity of the item
      pricePerItem - the price per item

  • Method Details

    • setQuantity

      public void setQuantity(int quantity)
      Sets the quantity of the item. Throws an exception if the quantity is less than 0.
      Parameters:
      quantity - the quantity of the part
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if quantity is less than 0.

    • setPricePerItem

      public void setPricePerItem(double pricePerItem)
      Sets the price per item. Throws an exception if the price is less than or equal to 0.
      Parameters:
      pricePerItem - the price per item
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if price is less than or equal to 0.

    • getPaymentAmount

      public double getPaymentAmount()
      Description copied from interface: Payable
      Calculate the payment amount for the implementing (concrete) class. This method should return the payment amount for the specific object that implements this interface
      Specified by:
      getPaymentAmount in interface Payable
      Returns:
      the payment amount for the object
